TEXT.citation: Early, R. J., & Whitehorn, J. (2003). One hundred Paiwan texts. Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University.
TEXT.BibTeX_citation: @book{100paiwantexts, author = {Robert Early and John Whitehorn}, title = {One Hundred Paiwan Texts}, year = {2003}, publisher = {Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University}}

S.FORM: pai timun a nia kaka i Igiris a mapułat, małimałi aravats a nasekełang mun tua kai nua Tsemas tua kiłivak nua Tsemas a kirimu; sa nu pasa Tayuangi anga ti Uaituun sinsi, sa ne pałalualuayi anga tua kiłivak nua Tsemas.

pai timon a nia kaka i Igiris a mapoljat, maljimalji aravac a nasekeljang mon toa kai noa Cemas toa kiljivak noa Cemas a kirimo; sa no pasa Tayoangi anga ti Uaitoon sinsi, sa ne paljaloaloayi anga toa kiljivak noa Cemas.
S.TRANSL: All our brothers and sisters in England, we are very thankful that you came to know the word of God earlier, and you sent Mr Whitehorn, and the love of God was made clear to us.

S.FORM: pai ka tjaisangas ika men a kemłang ki tjen a marekakakaka, ki matsidił a tja kama a naqemati tjanuitjen a i katsauan.
pai ka tjaisangas ika men a kemljang ki tjen a marekakakaka, ki macidilj a tja kama a naqemati tjanoitjen a i kacaoan.
S.TRANSL: Before that we did not know that we are brothers and sisters, and that we have one Father who created us all in the world.

S.FORM: łakua ka pasemalavan anga men ni Uaituun sinsi kałaluayin anga men, kemłang anga men tu marekakakaka itjen.
ljakoa ka pasemalavan anga men ni Uaitoon sinsi kaljaloayin anga men, kemljang anga men to marekakakaka itjen.
S.TRANSL: But when Mr Whitehorn told us we understood, and now we know that we are brothers and sisters.

S.FORM: manu marekakakaka itjen a mapułat a i katsauan, ayanga men.
mano marekakakaka itjen a mapoljat a i kacaoan, ayanga men.
S.TRANSL: So now we acknowledge that all of us in the world are brothers and sisters.

S.FORM: pai a kina-i-Tayuangan ni Uaituun sinsi nuka i tsadja aravats i gadu ika pulułalułayan tua pasemalaw tua kai nua Tsemas, tua tjemtjautsikel.
pai a kina-i-Tayoangan ni Uaitoon sinsi noka i cadja aravac i gado ika pololjaloljayan toa pasemalaw toa kai noa Cemas, toa tjemtjaocikel.
S.TRANSL: During Mr Whitehorn’s time in Taiwan even in very distant places in the mountains he has not shirked telling the word of God and preaching.

S.FORM: pai kana ika pitsul nua Tsemas, kana ikana men a zinuker ni Uaituun sinsi.
pai kana ika picol noa Cemas, kana ikana men a zinoker ni Uaitoon sinsi.
S.TRANSL: If it were not for the power of God Mr Whitehorn would not have reached us.

S.FORM: łakua ki anema pinapupitsulan nua Tsemas, ika napulułalułayan tu uri mapaseqełing amen uta, ayaya men a malevaleva; saka napaparangez anga men sakamaya tua Tsemas.
ljakoa ki anema pinapopicolan noa Cemas, ika napololjaloljayan to ori mapaseqeljing amen ota, ayaya men a malevaleva; saka napaparangez anga men sakamaya toa Cemas.
S.TRANSL: But he has been given power by God and has not shirked the task, so that we too could be saved; we gladly acknowledge this, and we have truly trusted in God.

S.FORM: pai tisun a ti Uaituun sinsi, djavadjavay aravats a su kina-i-Tayuangan.
pai tison a ti Uaitoon sinsi, djavadjavay aravac a so kina-i-Tayoangan.
S.TRANSL: Now Mr Whitehorn, we are very grateful for your time in Taiwan.

S.FORM: pai ki sun a zemuker anga itua mareka tja kaka i Igiris, ki sun a tjemautsiketsikel anga tua su kinasi-Tayuangan tua su zelian.
pai ki son a zemoker anga itoa mareka tja kaka i Igiris, ki son a tjemaocikecikel anga toa so kinasi-Tayoangan toa so zelian.
S.TRANSL: Now you will return to our brothers and sisters in England, and you will be telling them of your visit to Taiwan and your labours here.

S.FORM: ika manu men a dedet a su zinuker, djavadjavay aravats, Uaituun sinsi.
ika mano men a dedet a so zinoker, djavadjavay aravac, Uaitoon sinsi.
S.TRANSL: It is not as if we to whom you came lived near you; we are very grateful, Mr Whitehorn.

S.FORM: pai uła sun a kinizangan, uła sun a pinapupitsulan, uła sun a pinakatsuatsuay i katsauan nua naqemati a Tsemas tua su pasemalamalaw tua kai nua Tsemas, sa su kana tsemikel anga uta tjanuamen a i Tayuang a mareka su kaka.

pai olja son a kinizangan, olja son a pinapopicolan, olja son a pinakacoacoay i kacaoan noa naqemati a Cemas toa so pasemalamalaw toa kai noa Cemas, sa so kana cemikel anga ota tjanoamen a i Tayoang a mareka so kaka.
S.TRANSL: May you be guarded and strengthened, and may the creator God grant you to live long in the world for your telling of the word of God, and so may you come back again to us your brothers and sisters in Taiwan.

S.FORM: aitsu a tiamen ki men a napatjakisamułanga uta a łemaluay tua pazazekazekatj nua Tsemas, uła men a napenakalevanga uta tjanusun a ti, tjanusun, nu mangtjez anga sun a kitsepeliw a sema maza i Tayuang.

aico a tiamen ki men a napatjakisamoljanga ota a ljemaloay toa pazazekazekatj noa Cemas, olja men a napenakalevanga ota tjanoson a ti, tjanoson, no mangtjez anga son a kicepeliw a sema maza i Tayoang.
S.TRANSL: As for us we will more zealously try to understand the commands of God, so that we may gladden you, Mr-you, when you come back here to Taiwan.
